title: Write a real-world algebraic expression
prompt: Which method will calculate the total cost of a teaching program for an out-of-state student?
hint: Think about any price "per" item, and then what operation you would use to find what 5 of those items cost.
feedback:
Column <math><mi>s</mi></math> gives the cost per semester of the teaching programs. Column <math><mi>p</mi></math> gives the number of semesters in each teaching program. The total cost of the teaching program is the cost per semester times the number of semesters. The total cost of a teaching program for an out-of-state student can be found by multiplying <math>
<mrow>
 <mi>p</mi>
 <mo>⋅</mo>
<mi>s</mi>
</mrow>
</math>.
